How  to  Avoid  a  Home owners  Insurance  Claim  Den ial 
 Home owners  insurance  is  a  critical  component  of  your  home  ownership .  It  protects  your  investment ,  your  home  and  your  personal  belongings . 
 When  you  buy  a  home ,  you  are  also  buying  a  policy  that  protects  you  from  a  variety  of  accidents  and  unexpected  events . 
 For  example ,  if  you  have  a  home  that  is  damaged  by  fire  or  water ,  your  insurance  policy  will  cover  the  cost  of  repairs  and  replacement . 
 If  you  have  a  home  that  is  damaged  by  a  tornado  or  hurricane ,  your  policy  will  cover  the  cost  of  repairs  and  replacement . 
 If  you  have  a  home  that  is  damaged  by  a  flood ,  your  policy  will  cover  the  cost  of  repairs  and  replacement .

(CNN)A Duke student has admitted to hang.phi-2:
A  Duke  student  has  admitted  to  hanging  a  no ose  made  of  rope  from  a  tree  near  a  student  union ,  university  officials  said  Thursday . 
 The  prestigious  private  school  didn 't  identify  the  student ,  citing  federal  privacy  laws . 
 In  a  news  release ,  it  said  the  student  was  no  longer  on  campus  and  will  face  student  conduct  review . 
 The  student  was  identified  during  an  investigation  by  campus  police  and  the  office  of  student  affairs  and  admitted  to  placing  the  no ose  on  the  tree  early  Wednesday ,  the  university  said . 
 Officials  are  still  trying  to  determine  if  other  people  were  involved . 
 C riminal  investigations  into  the  incident  are  ongoing  as  well . 
 Students  and  faculty  members  marched  Wednesday  afternoon  chanting  " We  are  not  afraid .  We  stand  together ,"  after  pictures  of  the  no ose  were  passed  around  on  social  media . 
 At  a  forum  held  on  the  steps  of  Duke  Chapel ,  close  to  where  the  no ose  was  discovered  at  2  a . m .,  hundreds  of  people  gathered . 
 " You  came  here  for  the  reason  that  you  want  to  say  with  me ,  ' This  is  no  Duke  we  will  accept .  This  is  no  Duke  we  want .  This  is  not  the  Duke  we 're  here  to  experience .  And  this  is  not  the  Duke  we 're  here  to  create ,'  "  Duke  President  Richard  Bro d head  told  the  crowd . 
 The  incident  is  one  of  several  recent  racist  events  to  affect  college  students . 
 Last  month  a  fraternity  at  the  University  of  Oklahoma  had  its  charter  removed  after  a  video  surfaced  showing  members  using  the  N - word  and  referring  to  lyn ching  in  a  chant . 
 Two  students  were  expelled . 
 In  February ,  a  no ose  was  hung  around  the  neck  of  a  statue  of  a  famous  civil  rights  figure  at  the  University  of  Mississippi . 
 A  statement  issued  by  Duke  said  there  was  a  previous  report  of  hate  speech  directed  at  students  on  campus . 
 In  the  news  release ,  the  vice  president  for  student  affairs  called  the  no ose  incident  a  " cow ard ly  act ." 
 " To  wh omever  committed  this  hateful  and  stupid  act ,  I  just  want  to  say  that  if  your  intent  was  to  create  fear ,  it  will  have  the  opposite  effect ,"  Larry  Mon eta  said  Wednesday . 
 D uke  University  is  a  private  college  with  about  15 , 000  students  in  Durham ,  North  Carolina . 
 CNN 's  Dave  Al sup  contributed  to  this  report . 
 The  University  of  Oklahoma  fraternity  responsible  for  a  racist  video  that  led  to  the  charter  revocation  of  two  of  its  members  has  received  a  $ 200 , 000  fine  from  the  school . 
 The  university  also  suspended  the  fraternity 's  national  president  for  two  years  and  revoked  its  charter . 
 The  fraternity 's  national  president ,  Tyler  Johnson ,

 ## Your  task :  ** Rew rite **  the  above  paragraph  into  a  high  school  level  summar ization  in  multiple  paragraphs  while  keeping  as  many  content  as  possible ,  using  a  both  positive  and  negative  tone . 
 
 Answer : 
 T rey  Moses  and  Ellie  Meredith  may  seem  like  an  unlikely  couple ,  but  their  love  story  is  one  that  has  captured  the  hearts  of  many .  Trey ,  a  star  basketball  player  at  Eastern  High  School  in  Louisville ,  Kentucky ,  is  set  to  play  college  ball  next  year  at  Ball  State .  Ellie ,  on  the  other  hand ,  is  a  high  school  freshman  with  Down  syndrome .  Despite  their  differences ,  Trey  proposed  to  Ellie  during  her  P . E .  class ,  in  an  effort  to  make  her  prom  night  special . 
 
 T rey 's  decision  to  ask  Ellie  to  be  his  prom  date  may  seem  unusual  at  first ,  but  it  speaks  to  his  kind  and  caring  nature .  He  wanted  to  make  sure  that  Ellie  felt  included  and  not  left  out ,  as  she  often  struggles  with  friendships  due  to  her  developmental  disability .  Trey 's  proposal  was  made  in  the  gym ,  where  he  had  set  up  a  romantic  atmosphere  with  flowers  and  a  poster  that  referenced  Ellie 's  favorite  singer ,  Taylor  Swift . 
 
 Ell ie 's  parents  were  thrilled  with  Trey 's  proposal  and  gave  him  the  go - ahead  for  the  prom .  They  understand  the  challenges  that  Ellie  faces ,  but  they  are  grateful  for  the  support  and  acceptance  that  Trey  has  shown  her .  Trey 's  mother ,  She lly  Moses ,  is  particularly  proud  of  her  son 's  self lessness  and  his  dedication  to  helping  others ,  as  Trey  often  works  with  students  who  have  special  needs . 
 
 As  for  Ellie ,  she  is  excited  about  prom  but  also  feels  a  bit  overwhelmed  by  all  the  planning  that  needs  to  be  done .  She  can 't  stop  thinking  about  dress  shopping  and  wants  to  share  her  excitement  with  everyone  she  knows .  Despite  her  disability ,  Ellie  has  a  strong  sense  of  self  and  is  determined  to  make  the  most  of  her  high  school  experience . 
 
 In  conclusion ,  the  story  of  Trey  and  Ellie  is  a  heart warming  example  of  love  and  acceptance .  It  shows  that  despite  their  differences ,  they  have  found  common  ground  and  are  determined  to  support  each  other .  Their  prom  night  is  just  the  beginning  of  a  beautiful  journey  together . 
 
 Use  Case  1 :  A  Conversation  between  Trey  and  Ellie 's  Parents 
 
 T rey 's  parents ,  She lly  and  Mark ,  are  attending  a  parent - te acher  conference  at  Eastern  High  School .  They  have  been  informed  about  Ellie 's  struggles  with  friendships  and  want  to  discuss  potential  solutions  with  the  school .

(CNN)Governments around the world are us.phi-2: The  report  also  highlights  the  fact  that  " the  majority  of  people  on  death  row  are  from  poor  countries ,  where  they  are  often  denied  access  to  legal  representation  and  a  fair  trial ."  The  report  notes  the  lack  of  access  to  justice  in  many  countries  where  the  death  penalty  is  used ,  and  the  fact  that  the  majority  of  executions  are  carried  out  in  countries  with  " weak  or  non - existent "  safeguards  against  arbitrary  killing .  " In  many  countries ,  the  death  penalty  is  imposed  in  the  absence  of  a  fair  trial  and  without  the  benefit  of  independent  legal  representation ,"  the  report  states .  " Many  countries  that  retain  the  death  penalty  have  also  failed  to  establish  a  fair  and  independent  process  for  reviewing  the  legality  of  the  death  sentence ."  Despite  the  bleak  picture ,  the  report  also  contains  some  positive  findings .  The  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  has  risen  to  41 ,  up  from  39  in  2013 .  The  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  all  crimes  has  increased  to  29 ,  up  from  25  in  2013 .  " The  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  all  crimes  has  increased  to  29 ,  up  from  25  in  2013 ,"  the  report  states .  " These  include  the  four  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  all  crimes  since  2013 :  Afghanistan ,  Bangladesh ,  Guinea - B iss au  and  Moz amb ique ."  The  report  also  notes  that  in  2014 ,  four  countries  --  Argentina ,  Brazil ,  Canada  and  South  Africa  --  took  steps  towards  abolition  of  the  death  penalty .  " There  is  a  growing  consensus  that  the  death  penalty  is  an  outdated  and  in humane  practice ,"  the  report  states .  " The  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  all  crimes  has  increased  to  29 ,  up  from  25  in  2013 .  These  include  the  four  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  all  crimes  since  2013 :  Afghanistan ,  Bangladesh ,  Guinea - B iss au  and  Moz amb ique ."  The  report  also  highlights  a  growing  trend  among  countries  to  reject  the  use  of  the  death  penalty  for  terrorism .  " The  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  terrorism  has  increased  to  12 ,  up  from  11  in  2013 ,"  the  report  states .  " These  include  the  four  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  terrorism  since  2013 :  Argentina ,  Brazil ,  Canada  and  South  Africa ."  The  report  also  notes  that  in  2014 ,  three  countries  --  Albania ,  India  and  the  United  Arab  Emirates  --  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  terrorism - related  offences .  " In  2014 ,  the  number  of  countries  that  have  abolished  the  death  penalty  for  terrorism - related  offences  has  increased  to  three ,  up  from  two  in  2013 :  Albania  and  the  United  Arab  Emirates ,"  the  report  states .  J .  Paul  Getty 's  grandson  dies 
 ( CNN ) Andrew  Getty ,  one  of  the  heirs  to  billions  of  oil  money ,  appears  to  have  died  of  natural  causes ,  a  Los  Angeles  Police  Department  spokesman  said .  The  coroner 's  preliminary  assessment  is  there  was  no  foul  play  involved  in  the  death  of  Getty ,  grandson  of  oil  ty coon  J .  Paul  Getty ,  said  Detective  Me ghan  Agu ilar .  Andrew  Getty ,  47 ,  had  " sever al  health  issues ,"  Agu ilar  said ,  adding  that  an  autopsy  will  be  conducted .  There  is  no  criminal  investigation  underway ,  he  said .  Some  medication  had  also  been  recovered  from  Getty 's  home ,  though  investigators  don 't  know  whether  Getty  was  taking  it  or  what  his  medical  history  was ,  Ed  Winter ,  assistant  chief  in  the  Los  Angeles  County  coroner 's  office ,  told  CNN  affiliate  KT LA  Tuesday  night .  KT LA  reported  that  Getty  was  found  on  his  side  near  a  bathroom  in  his  home .  Getty 's  parents ,  Ann  and  Gordon  Getty ,  released  a  statement  confirming  their  son 's  death  and  asking  for  privacy .  Where  the  Getty  family  fortune  came  from .  Gordon  Getty  is  one  of  three  living  sons  of  J .  Paul  Getty ,  the  oil  bar on  who  was  thought  to  be  the  richest  man  in  the  world  at  the  time  of  his  death  in  1976 .  Gordon  Getty ,  81 ,  has  a  net  worth  of  $ 2 . 1  billion ,  according  to  Forbes .  One  other  son  died  in  1958  and  another  died  in  1973 .  Gordon  Getty  spearheaded  the  controversial  sale  of  Getty  to  Tex aco  for  $ 10  billion  in  1984 .  In  its  list  of  richest  American  families ,  Forbes  estimated  the  Getty s '  net  worth  to  be  about  $ 5  billion .  Court  records  show  Andrew  Getty  had  recently  filed  to  get  a  restraining  order  against  an  ex - girlfriend .  A  hearing  in  the  case  had  been  scheduled  for  next  week .  In  his  request ,  Getty  said  he  had  been  diagnosed  with  a  serious  medical  condition  in  2013 .  " A  rise  in  my  blood  pressure  places  me  in  grave  risk  of  substantial  and  irre parable  injury  or  death ,"  he  wrote  in  the  petition .  " My  doctors  have  advised  that  heated  arguments  can  cause  my  blood  pressure  to  rise  dangerously ."  Andrew  Getty  had  three  brothers  and  three  half - s isters .  People  we 've  lost  in  2015 .  CNN 's  Doug  Cr iss ,  Janet  Di G iac omo ,  Mark  Mo oney ,  Mike  Love ,  Julie  In  and  Cher i  Moss burg  contributed  to  this  report .

The  city 's  Department  of  Public  Works  and  High ways  said  Saturday  that  the  storm  could  cause  flooding  and  landsl ides  due  to  torrent ial  rains .  The  National  Disaster  Risk  Reduction  and  Management  Council  ( N DR R MC )  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  3  inches  ( 7 . 6  centimeters )  of  rain  to  Manila ,  which  is  less  than  the  6  to  8  inches  ( 15  to  20  centimeters )  that  the  city  experienced  during  Typhoon  O nd oy  in  2009 .  But  the  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  lead  to  flash  floods  and  landsl ides  in  areas  with  steep  slopes  and  poor  drainage .  It  also  warned  of  mud sl ides  in  the  mountainous  provinces  of  Northern  Lu zon .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  5  inches  ( 13  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  Eastern  Vis ay as  region ,  which  is  home  to  the  island  of  C eb u .  The  agency  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  4  inches  ( 10  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  central  and  southern  regions ,  which  are  home  to  the  island  of  Mind ana o .  It  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  2  inches  ( 5  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  Western  Vis ay as  region ,  which  is  home  to  the  island  of  Pan ay .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  1  inch  ( 2 . 5  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  island  of  Lu zon ,  which  is  home  to  the  capital  city  of  Manila .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  1  inch  ( 2 . 5  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  island  of  Bat anes ,  which  is  home  to  the  northern  province  of  Bab u yan  Islands .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  1  inch  ( 2 . 5  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  island  of  Pal awan ,  which  is  home  to  the  southern  province  of  Pal awan .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  0 . 5  inches  ( 1 . 25  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  island  of  Mind oro ,  which  is  home  to  the  provinces  of  Occ idental  Mind oro  and  Oriental  Mind oro .  The  N DR R MC  said  that  the  storm  could  bring  up  to  0 . 5  inches  ( 1 . 25  centimeters )  of  rain  to  the  island  of  R omb lon ,  which  is  home  to  the  province  of  R omb lon . (CNN)For the first time in eight years,.phi-2:
" I 'm  just  thrilled  to  be  back ,"  Barker  told  " Good  Morning  America "  on  Thursday .  " I 'm  very  excited  to  be  back  on  the  show ."  Barker ,  who  was  honored  with  a  star  on  the  Hollywood  Walk  of  Fame  on  March  31 ,  has  been  a  fixture  of  American  television  for  decades .  He  hosted  " The  Price  Is  Right "  from  1973  to  2007 ,  and  also  hosted  " The  Price  Is  Right :  Family  Fe ud "  from  1983  to  2007 .  During  his  time  on  " The  Price  Is  Right ,"  Barker  was  also  known  for  his  signature  catch phrase ,  " Come  on  down !"  He  retired  from  " The  Price  Is  Right "  in  2007 ,  but  has  remained  active  in  the  entertainment  industry .  He  has  hosted  several  specials  and  guest - host ed  other  game  shows .  In  addition  to  his  work  on  television ,  Barker  has  also  written  several  books ,  including  " The  Price  Is  Right :  The  Official  Price  Is  Right  Encyclopedia "  and  " The  Price  Is  Right :  The  Official  Price  Is  Right  Game  Show  Encyclopedia ."  He  has  also  made  several  appearances  on  talk  shows  and  has  been  a  guest  on  numerous  game  shows .  Barker 's  return  to  " The  Price  Is  Right "  was  met  with  excitement  from  fans  and  fellow  hosts  alike .  The  show 's  producers  have  been  working  on  a  special  episode  to  celebrate  Barker 's  return ,  which  is  set  to  air  later  this  year .  Barker 's  presence  on  the  show  will  be  a  welcome  addition ,  as  he  brings  years  of  experience  and  charm  to  the  host 's  chair .  The  " Price  Is  Right "  is  known  for  its  iconic  set  and  catchy  theme  song ,  and  Barker 's  return  will  help  to  keep  the  show  fresh  and  entertaining  for  viewers . 
  
 
 Topic :  Social  studies -- C ulture -- C ulture  and  norms  and  customs 
 
 Once  upon  a  time ,  in  a  small  town  called  Oak ville ,  there  lived  three  friends  named  Sarah ,  Mark ,  and  Emily .  They  were  all  in  middle  school  and  had  recently  started  learning  about  different  cultures  and  traditions .  One  day ,  their  social  studies  teacher ,  Mrs .  Johnson ,  assigned  them  a  project  on  cultural  norms  and  customs . 
 
 Exc ited  about  the  project ,  Sarah ,  Mark ,  and  Emily  decided  to  meet  up  at  the  local  library  to  research  and  gather  information .  As  they  sat  around  a  table  with  their  books  and  laptops ,  Sarah  asked ,  " How  can  we  learn  more  about  cultural  norms  and  customs ?" 
 
 Mark  replied ,  " We  can  start  by  reading  books  and  articles  about  different  cultures .  They  often  provide  valuable  insights  into  the  traditions  and  customs  followed  by  people  from  various  parts  of  the  world ."
